subject: RE: [junit] Replacing Logger class
msgSnippet: Hi David, I guess I could write my own wrapper but I was hoping someone had already invented this wheel for log4j. At the moment, I can programmatically
messageBody:
Hi David,

I guess I could write my own wrapper but I was hoping someone had
already invented this wheel for log4j.

At the moment, I can programmatically control logging so my test classes
are turning off logging when they run. It works but not ideal.

Thanks

Rakesh

-----Original Message-----
From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
David Saff
Sent: 29 September 2005 19:45
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Replacing Logger class


Rakesh,

Would it be possible, rather than making calls directly against the
log4j classes, to call thin wrappers that you control, that you can turn

off during testing?

David Saff

Rakesh Patel wrote:

> Hi All,
>
> Does anyone know how to disable log4j logging when running tests.
> Reading through Junit in Action (excellent btw) it shows an example
> where code is refactored in such a way that the Logger is actually
> mocked out. Unfortunately, I cannot see how to do this with log4j
> since it is a class rather than an interface.
>
> Any help appreciated!
>
> Thanks
>
> Rakesh
>
> PS I am using the 1.3 alpha release version of log4j which has a bug -

> logger creation always logs even when you turn logging off.
>
>
